person.persName: Silas W. Hunt (Henry County survery, farmer, and soldier)

body.p: A Kentucky surveyor, farmer, and soldier. Lived in Henry County, Kentucky in 1860. Married to Lucinda Hunt. Father of A. S. Hunt, Elizabeth Hunt, Philip P. Hunt, Mathew W. Hunt, Nicholas O. Hunt, Rheuben P. Hunt, and John Allen Hunt. Owned seven enslaved persons in 1850 and hired out two enslaved person in 1860. Worked as a Henry County surveyor in 1842, 1848, and 1850. Worked as a Henry County farmer in 1860. Served a lieutenant colonel in a unit of the Kentucky State Guard in 1862. A founding member of the Kentucky River Navigation Company in 1865. Member of the Masonic Order at Faithful Friend Lodge, No. 313 in Lockport, Kentucky.
